buyout.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a situation in which someone gains control of a company by buying all or most of its shares
buyout.translation[1].definitions[0].def: when a person or organization buys a business
buyout.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: The company has accepted a buyout offer of $44.50 a share.
buyout.translation[1].definitions[1].def: when a person or organization buys all the shares in a company owned by a particular shareholder
buyout.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: The company said it was continuing to negotiate a buyout of minority stakeholders.
buyout.translation[1].definitions[2].def: money given to someone to persuade them to leave a company
buyout.translation[1].definitions[2].exa: The airline plans to cut its payroll by 5,000, mainly through buyouts.
